intro: Parinari bangweolensis, commonly known as the Bangweolensis parinari, is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree native to Central and Southern Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are usually elliptical or ovate in shape. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, followed by round, fleshy fruits that are often red or orange when mature. It thrives in tropical and subtropical regions, often found in moist lowland forests and along riverbanks.
